assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: On 1 July 2020, an ex-soldier was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Rawis, Donsol, Sorsogon. The motive for the attack was unclear.

On 1 July 2020, a suspected Dawlah Islamiyah militant was shot dead while three others escaped during a firefight with the police in Polomolok, South Cotabato. Police said they also recovered weapons and other items, including several grams of shabu (crystal meth), from the militants during the operation.

On 1 July 2020, four suspected BIFF militants (Dawlah Islamiyah in some reports) were shot dead by the police at a checkpoint in Barangay Timbangan, Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao, after the former reportedly refused to have their vehicle inspected for weapons and explosives.
On 2 July 2020, a soldier was wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants in Datu Unsay, Maguindanao.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: On 2 July 2020, unidentified assailants with assault rifles fired at an outpost of the military's Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit (CAFGU) as well as civilians' houses in Barangay Labu-Labu, Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao. The outpost seemed to be empty at the time of attack, based on reports, while civilians fled the area. There were no reported casualties. The gun attack happened immediately after a grenade attack on CAFGU auxiliaries earlier in the same barangay.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: On 2 July 2020, an auxiliary of the military's Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit (CAFGU) was killed while his companion was wounded in a grenade attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Labu-Labu, Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao. The casualties were manning a COVID-19 (coronavirus) quarantine checkpoint at the time of attack.
On 2 July 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Sugcad, Polangui, Albay. Police said they recovered five sachets of shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect.
On 2 July 2020, a barangay councilor was shot dead by unidentified assailants right inside the barangay hall in Barangay 484, Sampaloc, Manila. The motive for the attack was unclear.

On 2 July 2020, a drug suspect was killed while three others were arrested during a police raid in Barangay Samon, Cabanatuan, Nueva Ecija. Police said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from the suspects during the operation.

On 3 July 2020, Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte in Manila signed into law the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020. The law, supported by the country's security establishment, has also led to protests and condemnation, with critics saying that the law, which expands the scope of warrantless arrests, would be used to target activists, exacerbate State red-tagging, and quash legitimate dissent.

On 3 July 2020, around 50 activists led by BAYAN staged demonstrations in Angeles and Mabalacat in Pampanga (coded at Angeles), to commemorate the death anniversary of a slain Dutch immigrant and activist, and to condemn the Anti-Terrorism Bill, which they said would result in a law that will be used to target activists, exacerbate red-tagging and quash legitimate dissent. [size=around 50]

On 3 July 2020, a government soldier was wounded in an IED explosion detonated by suspected NPA militants in Barangay Igbucagay, Hamtic, Antique. The NPA and the military then engaged in a brief, two-minute firefight, before the rebels withdrew. There were no reported additional casualties.
On 3 July 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Parista, Lupao, Nueva Ecija. Police said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from the suspect.
On 3 July 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Malainen Bago, Naic, Cavite.
On 3 July 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Cavite West, Palo, Leyte. Police said the slain suspect was a high-value target.

On 3 July 2020, a drug suspect was killed while four others were arrested during a police raid in Barangay Santo Cristo Sur, Gapan, Nueva Ecija. Police said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from the suspects.
On 3 July 2020, a reported former NPA member was shot dead by suspected NPA militants in Barangay Buenavista, Tandag, Surigao del Sur.

On 3 July 2020, a suspected BIFF militant transporting an improvised, mobile-phone activated bomb on motorbike was intercepted and arrested at a joint police and military checkpoint in Barangay Madia, Datu Saudi-Ampatuan, Maguindanao. It was not clear where the he intended to bring his bomb to.
On 3 July 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Santa Ana, Taytay, Rizal. Police said they recovered 200 grams of shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect.

On 3 July 2020, the NPA and the military engaged in a 40-minute firefight in Barangay Hinalaan, Kalamansig, Sultan Kudarat, after NPA militants reportedly attempted to burn heavy equipment belonging to a construction company operating in the area. A government soldier was wounded, while the military reported that there could be some NPA fatalities as evidenced by bloodstains found in the area.

On 3 July 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Hilamonan, Kabankalan, Negros Occidental. Police said they recovered several grams of shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect during the operation.

[size=no report]

On 4 July 2020, a Muslim preacher was shot dead by unidentified motorcycle-riding assailants in Barangay Baluno, Naga, Zamboanga Sibugay. The motive for the attack was unclear.
On 5 July 2020, a drug and kidnapping suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Tungkop, Minglanilla, Cebu. Police said the slain suspect was involved in a drug-related kidnapping incident.

On 5 July 2020, three suspected NPA militants were killed during a firefight between the NPA and the police in Barangay Bagacay, Mobo, Masbate. Police said the encounter ensued while they were attempting to serve warrants of arrest on suspected rebels. Police also reported retrieving weapons from the rebels.

source: Philippine Star; GMA News; Tempo (Philippines); Arab News
notes: On 6 July 2020, an Abu Sayyaf faction with close ties to the Islamic State engaged the military in an hour-long firefight in Barangay Tanum, Patikul, Sulu. The military received air support during the operation. Five Abu Sayyaf militants were killed while an undetermined number were wounded in the related clashes in Barangays Bakong, Buhanginan and Tanum (coded as three events). Two government soldiers were also reported wounded. Five fatalities distributed across three events. Police initially sought to verify information that the new emir of the Islamic State in Southeast Asia was among those killed, but later said that the emir was only seriously injured.

source: Arab News; Philippine Star; GMA News; Tempo (Philippines)

Two government soldiers were also reported wounded. Five fatalities distributed across three events. Police initially sought to verify information that the new emir of the Islamic State in Southeast Asia was among those killed, but later said that the emir was only seriously injured.

Police initially sought to verify information that the new emir of the Islamic State in Southeast Asia was among those killed, but later said that the emir was only seriously injured.

On 7 July 2020, various groups and individuals staged a demonstration at the University of the Philippines Diliman campus in Quezon City against the newly-signed Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020, which they said would be used to target activists, exacerbate red-tagging and quash legitimate dissent. [size=no report]

On 7 July 2020, the chief inquest prosecutor of the City of Manila was shot dead in an attack by unidentified assailants along Quirino Avenue in Paco, Manila. The motive for the attack was unclear, though thought to be work-related.

On 7 July 2020, an employee of the social welfare and development office of Pangasinan province was shot dead by a man reported to be a police officer in Barangay Cacaritan, San Carlos, Pangasinan. There were few details about the incident and the motive for the attack was unclear.

source: Mindanao Goldstar Daily; Manila Bulletin; Philippine News Agency
notes: On 7 July 2020, two suspected NPA militants were killed during a firefight between the NPA and the military in Barangay Diatagon, Lianga, Surigao del Sur. The bodies were found by the military on 19 July 2020.
On 8 July 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Burnay, Talavera, Nueva Ecija. Police said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect.

On 8 July 2020, the relatives of a soldier killed during an encounter between the police and the military in Barangay Walled City, Jolo, Sulu on 29 June 2020 staged a demonstration calling for justice during the said soldier's funeral in Tabuk City, Kalinga. [size=no report]
On 8 July 2020, suspected NPA militants reportedly fired indiscriminately at civilians in Barangay Tacayan, Tapaz, Capiz. A child was reportedly wounded.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Philippine Information Agency; Philippine News Agency; Philippine Star; Sunstar (Philippines)
notes: On 9 July 2020, a suspected NPA militant was killed while four police officers were wounded after suspected NPA militants attacked a police COVID-19 (coronavirus) quarantine checkpoint in Barangay Potongan (assumed Upper Potongan), Concepcion, Misamis Occidental. One of the wounded police officers died the next day due to injuries from the attack.

On 10 July 2020, a barangay captain heading the Association of Barangay Captains in Ibaan, Batangas was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Poblacion, Ibaan, Batangas. The motive for the attack was unclear.

assoc_actor_2: Drug Suspects (Philippines); Government of the Philippines (2016-)
source: GMA News; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Rappler
notes: On 10 July 2020, a drug suspect serving as town mayor of Santo Nino, South Cotabato was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Poblacion, Santo Nino, South Cotabato. Police said that the mayor was on Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte's 'narco list' of prominent personalities allegedly connected to the drug trade, which has been publicly released on multiple occasions since 2016.

On 10 July 2020, the Philippine Congress in Quezon City voted to deny broadcaster ABS CBN's franchise renewal application, effectively ending the broadcast operations of the country's largest media network. ABS CBN was forced off the airwaves on 5 May 2020 upon the National Telecommunications Commission's orders, after its 25-year operating franchise expired. Several groups condemned the franchise denial, saying it represented a worsening crackdown on press freedom.

On 10 July 2020, two suspected NPA militants were killed in a 45-minute firefight with the military in Barangay Batayan, Kalawit, Zamboanga del Norte. The military also reported retrieving weapons from the rebels. The body of the second rebel fatality was found the next day.

assoc_actor_1: NUJP: National Union of Journalists of the Philippines; Journalists (Philippines)
notes: On 10 July 2020, television celebrities, employees and supporters of broadcaster ABS CBN, including the National Union of Journalists of the Philippines (NUJP), protested at the Batasang Pambansa Complex in Quezon City, in order to demand Congress's approval of ABS CBN's franchise renewal application. After Congress voted to deny ABS CBN's franchise renewal on the same day, the demonstration continued in front of the ABS CBN headquarters in Quezon City. [size=no report]

On 11 July 2020, the NPA and the military engaged in a 10-minute firefight in Barangay Pange, Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte. There were no reported casualties on either side, though the military reported retrieving weapons and other items from the rebels.

On 11 July 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Pacol, Naga, Camarines Sur. Police said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect, who they added was on the city's drug watchlist.

On 11 July 2020, a fisherman-cum-drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Poblacion, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. On 12 July 2020, two drug suspects were killed during a police raid in Barangay Luklukan (assumed Luklukan Norte), Jose Panganiban, Camarines Norte. Police said that they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspects, who police also said were on their drug watchlist.

On 13 July 2020, a roadside IED planted by unidentified assailants detonated near a military detachment in Barangay Meta, Datu Unsay, Maguindanao. A military vehicle carrying soldiers was lightly damaged in the explosion as it passed by, though there were no reported casualties.

On 13 July 2020, a municipal government employee was wounded in a gun attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Langilan, San Miguel, Zamboanga del Sur. Police said that political rivalry was the likely motive of the attack.

On 15 July 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Canlalay, Binan, Laguna. Police said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect.

On 16 July 2020, nurses of the San Lazaro Hospital staged a silent protest in front of the hospital in Santa Cruz, Manila, in order to demand sufficient personal protective equipment (PPE) for medical personnel amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic and uninterrupted salaries during mandatory quarantines. [size=no report]
On 16 July 2020, the town mayor of Tagapul-an, Samar was wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Sugod, Tagapul-an, Samar. The motive for the attack was unclear.

On 17 July 2020, two drug suspects were killed during a police raid in Barangay Diliman (assumed Diliman I), San Rafael, Bulacan. Police said they recovered 220 grams of shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspects.

On 20 July 2020, the NPA and the military engaged in a 10-minute firefight in Barangay Diatagon, Lianga, Surigao del Sur. assoc_actor_2: Former Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: On 25 July 2020, a former police officer was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Abucay, Tacloban, Leyte. The motive for the killing was unclear.

On 25 July 2020, medical workers at the National Kidney and Transplant Institute in Quezon City held a silent protest at the hospital, in order to condemn the shortcomings of the government response to the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic and in order to demand better working conditions for medical workers. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: NUJP: National Union of Journalists of the Philippines; Journalists (Philippines)
notes: On 25 July 2020, journalists led by the National Union of Journalists of the Philippines (NUJP) staged a demonstration at the Press Freedom Monument in Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental, to condemn Congress's denial of ABS CBN's franchise renewal application. [size=no report]

On 25 July 2020, the NPA and the military engaged in a firefight in Barangay Pinanag-an, Borongan, Eastern Samar. There were no reported casualties on both sides, though the military reported retrieving weapons and other items from the rebels.
On 25 July 2020, a farmer was shot dead by suspected NPA militants in Barangay Carol-an, Kabankalan, Negros Occidental. The motive for the attack was unclear.
On 25 July 2020, two drug suspects were killed during a police raid in Barangay Kulapi, Lucban, Quezon. Police said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspects.

assoc_actor_2: Former Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: Around 25 July 2020 (from 24-26 July), a dismissed former police officer and his aide were killed by unidentified assailants near Barangay Killo, Sison, Pangasinan. The deads, missing since 24 July, were found bearing signs of torture in a creek in Barangay Killo on 26 July. The exact time and date of the attack are unknown. The motive for the attack was unclear.

Around 26 July 2020 (weekend of), two drug and robbery suspects were killed while another escaped during a police raid in Barangay Bagong Silangan, Quezon City. Police said they retrieved shabu (crystal meth) from the suspects.

On 26 July 2020, a drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Tondo, Manila. Police said the slain suspect, who is also the sister of a city prosecutor, had previously been detained on drug charges but was released following a plea bargaining agreement.

On 26 July 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Kilada, Matalam, Cotabato. Police said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect, whom they described as a high-value target.
On 26 July 2020, the NPA and the military engaged in a firefight in Barangay Poblacion, Suyo, Ilocos Sur. There were no reported casualties on both sides.

On 26 July 2020, the NPA and the military engaged in a seven-minute firefight in Barangay Nataban, San Carlos, Negros Occidental. There were no reported casualties on both sides, though the military reported retrieving weapons and other items from the rebels.

On 26 July 2020, a suspected NPA militant was killed while a government soldier was wounded during a 20-minute clash between the NPA and the military in Barangay Balwan, Palimbang, Sultan Kudarat. The military also said it retrieved weapons from the slain rebel.

On 27 July 2020, the day of Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte's annual State of the Nation Address, demonstrators led by such groups as Anakbayan and BAYAN staged a demonstration in Dasmarinas, Cavite, in order to condemn the Duterte administration, which they criticized for the signing of the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020, the denial of broadcaster ABS CBN's franchise renewal, and the shortcomings of the government response to the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. [size=no report]

On 27 July 2020, the day of Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte's annual State of the Nation Address, about 10 demonstrators led by BAYAN demonstrated in front of the ABS CBN Central Visayas compound in Barangay Jagobiao, Mandaue, Cebu, in order to condemn the Duterte administration, which they criticized for the signing of the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020, the denial of broadcaster ABS CBN's franchise renewal, and the shortcomings of the government response to the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. [size=about 10]

assoc_actor_1: KADAMAY: Kalipunan ng Damayang Mahihirap; Women (Philippines)
notes: On 27 July 2020, the day of Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte's annual State of the Nation Address, women demonstrators from KADAMAY staged an 'online' protest in Barangay Cacarong Matanda, Pandi, Bulacan, in order to condemn the policies of the Duterte administration. Four of the demonstrators (five in some reports) were arrested by the police. KADAMAY condemned the arrests, saying the demonstrators only held placards and took selfies for the online protest, but police say they rallied without a permit. [size=four]

assoc_actor_1: Anakbayan; BAYAN: Bagong Alyansang Makabayan; KABATAAN: Kabataan Partylist; LGBT (Philippines); Students (Philippines)
notes: On 27 July 2020, the day of the President's annual State of the Nation Address, about 300 demonstrators from groups such as Anakbayan, BAYAN, KABATAAN, and other student groups, staged a demonstration at the University of the Philippines (UP) campus in Los Banos, Laguna, to criticize the Duterte administration for signing of the Anti-Terrorism Act, denying broadcaster ABS CBN's franchise renewal, and the government's unsatisfactory response to the coronavirus pandemic. About 62 activists from BAYAN Cavite, Katipunan ng mga Samahan ng Magbubukid sa Timog Katagalugan, and Anakbayan Cavite on their way to the demonstration in Los Banos from an earlier demonstration in Dasmarinas, Cavite, were held by the police in Carmona, Cavite. 23 other activists from Anakbayan Laguna, KABATAAN Laguna, LGBT group Queer Quezon, Anakbayan Quezon, and Pagkakaisa ng mga Magsasaka sa Ikalawang Distrito ng Quezon, as well as journalists, heading to the UP demonstration were also held by the police on two separate occasions at a checkpoint near Camp Macario Sakay in Los Banos, Laguna. [size=about 300]

On 27 July 2020, the day of Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte's annual State of the Nation Address, demonstrators from youth groups staged a demonstration in Tuguegarao, Cagayan, in order to condemn the policies of the Duterte administration. The police reportedly overwhelmed the demonstration and arrested two activists and two paralegals. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: KMP: Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas; Farmers (Philippines)
notes: On 27 July 2020, at least 20 farmers led by KMP staged a demonstration in Aloguinsan, Cebu, in order to condemn the Duterte administration, which they criticized for the shortcomings of the government response to the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic, including the inadequate aid to farmers. The demonstration was dispersed by the police. [size=at least 20]

assoc_actor_1: BAYAN: Bagong Alyansang Makabayan; KMU: Kilusang Mayo Uno; Lumad Ethnic Group (Philippines); Manobo Ethnic Group (Philippines); Sentro ng mga Nagkakaisa at Progresibong Manggagawa; Labour Group (Philippines); Refugees/IDPs (Philippines)
notes: On 27 July 2020, the day of the President's annual State of the Nation Address, people led by BAYAN and KMU staged a demonstration in front of the KMU office in Davao City, Davao del Sur, to criticize the Duterte administration for signing the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020, denying broadcaster ABS CBN's franchise renewal, and the government's unsatisfactory response to the coronavirus pandemic. Demonstrators held the action in front of the KMU office after police cordoned off Freedom Park, the original venue, and blocked demonstrators from gathering there. Another labour group, Sentro, also protested against the Duterte administration elsewhere in the city. Manobo (Lumad) refugees, who have been sheltering long-term at the United Church of Christ in the Philippines grounds in Haran, Davao City, also held a demonstration there, criticizing the government's human rights abuses and the impact of militarization on their communities. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: AGHAM: Advocates of Science and Technology for the People; AHW: Alliance of Health Workers; AMRSP: Association of Major Religious Superiors in the Philippines; Bahaghari; Bayan Muna; BAYAN: Bagong Alyansang Makabayan; BIEN Pilipinas: BPO Industry Employees Network; CAP: Concerned Artists of the Philippines; COURAGE: Confederation for Unity, Recognition and Advancement of Government Employees; FNU: Filipino Nurses United; HEAD: Health Alliance for Democracy; KARAPATAN: Alliance for the Advancement of People's Rights; KMP: Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas; KMU: Kilusang Mayo Uno; Nagkaisa!; NUJP: National Union of Journalists of the Philippines; NUSP: National Union of Students in the Philippines; PAGGAWA: Pagkakaisa ng Uring Manggagawa; PAHRA: Philippine Alliance of Human Rights Advocates; PISTON: Pinagkaisang Samahan ng mga Tsuper at Operator Nationwide; PM: Partido Manggagawa; Sentro ng mga Nagkakaisa at Progresibong Manggagawa; UMA Pilipinas: Unyon ng mga Manggagawa sa Agrikultura; Catholic Christian Group (Philippines); Farmers (Philippines); Health Workers (Philippines); Journalists (Philippines); Labour Group (Philippines); LGBT (Philippines); Students (Philippines); Teachers (Philippines)
source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Sunstar (Philippines); ABS CBN; Bulatlat; Philippine Star; Manila Bulletin
notes: On 27 July 2020, the day of the President's annual State of the Nation Address, at least 1800 demonstrators, led by groups such as AGHAM, AHW, AMRSP, Bahaghari, Bayan Muna, BAYAN, BIEN Pilipinas, CAP, COURAGE, FNU, HEAD, KARAPATAN, KMU, KMP, Nagkaisa!, NUJP, NUSP, PAGGAWA, PAHRA, PISTON, PM, Sentro, and UMA Pilipinas and other student, teacher and religious groups, demonstrated at the University of the Philippines (UP) Diliman campus and nearby areas in Quezon City, to criticize the Duterte administration for signing of the Anti-Terrorism Act, denying broadcaster ABS CBN's franchise renewal, and the government's unsatisfactory response to the coronavirus pandemic. PAHRA and AMRSP also led a motorcade demonstration in front of the ABS CBN headquarters in Quezon City before joining the UP demonstration. Five demonstrators from PISTON making their way to UP were arrested by the police near the Quezon Memorial Circle, in Quezon City, while five other demonstrators in Caloocan and 24 in Marikina-all on their way to the UP protest-were blocked and arrested by the police, purportedly for violating COVID-19 protocols. In the evening, a smaller demonstration led by many of the same organizations took place in front of the ABS CBN headquarters in Quezon City. [size=at least 1800]

assoc_actor_1: Akbayan Citizens' Action Party; Catholic Christian Group (Philippines)
notes: On 27 July 2020, the day of Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte's annual State of the Nation Address, demonstrators from Akbayan staged a silent demonstration during a Catholic mass dedicated to peace and justice at the Quiapo Church in Manila. The demonstrators held placards criticizing the government-sponsored Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020. Police entered the Church and seized the protest materials while the mass was ongoing. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: GABRIELA: General Assembly Binding Women for Reforms, Integrity, Equality, Leadership, and Action; PISTON: Pinagkaisang Samahan ng mga Tsuper at Operator Nationwide; YANAT: Youth Act Now Against Tyranny; Farmers (Philippines); Labour Group (Philippines); Students (Philippines); Women (Philippines)
notes: On 27 July 2020, the day of Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte's annual State of the Nation Address, demonstrators led by such groups as Bicolana GABRIELA, Condor-PISTON Bicol, YANAT and local farmer group Organisasyon ng mga Magsasaka sa Albay staged a demonstration in Legazpi, Albay, in order to condemn the Duterte administration, which they criticized for the signing of the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020, the denial of broadcaster ABS CBN's franchise renewal, and the shortcomings of the government response to the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. Some demonstrators also called for the resumption of public transport and the safe reopening of classes. The police intervened and prevented most of the demonstrators from demonstrating at the Penaranda Park after marching across the city. [size=no report]

actor2: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Prison Guards
notes: On 27 July 2020, two inmates were killed while five others were wounded by jail guards, after inmates rioted and attacked jail guards in an attempt to escape from the Calbayog City Jail in Calbayog, Samar. [size=at least 7]

On 27 July 2020, the day of Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte's annual State of the Nation Address, demonstrators staged a demonstration in front of the Baguio Cathedral in Baguio, Benguet, in order to condemn the Duterte administration, which they criticized for the signing of the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020, feared to further endanger human rights defenders and anti-mining activists in the region. [size=no report]
On 27 July 2020, the military recovered an NPA arms cache containing several explosives and ammunition in Mabini, Davao de Oro.

On 27 July 2020, the day of Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte's annual State of the Nation Address, demonstrators led by Akbayan and Balaod Mindanao staged a demonstration at the Plaza Divisoria in Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental, in order to condemn the Duterte administration, which they criticized for the signing of the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020, the denial of broadcaster ABS CBN's franchise renewal, and the shortcomings of the government response to the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. [size=no report]
On 27 July 2020, six police officers were left unscathed in an attack by suspected NPA militants in Barangay Santiago, Santa Maria, Laguna.

On 27 July 2020, a doctor serving as director of the government-run National Center for Mental Health was shot dead by unidentified assailants along Tandang Sora Avenue in Quezon City (Metro Manila, National Capital Region). Later reports indicated that other employees of the hospital orchestrated the killing, in connection with the director's anti-corruption efforts and his filing of a case at the Office of the Ombudsman against another hospital official for alleged graft and corruption.

On 27 July 2020, a Dawlah Islamiyah militant who was also a drug suspect was killed during a shootout with the police in Barangay Sulit, Polomolok, South Cotabato. No police officers were wounded during the shootout. Police said they retrieved shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect, who they said to be on the town's drug watchlist.

On 28 July 2020, a Dawlah Islamiyah militant-cum-drug suspect arrested by the police was killed while already in police custody in Tboli, South Cotabato. Police claimed that the militant attempted to grab a police officer's firearm, and the firearm reportedly went off as the police officer and the militant grappled for control, with the bullet hitting and killing the militant.

assoc_actor_2: Cordillera Ethnic Group (Philippines); Former Government of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: On 28 July 2020, a Cordillera indigenous people representative and former mayor of Flora, Apayao was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Poblacion West, Flora, Apayao. The motive for the attack was unclear.

source: ABS CBN; GMA News; Philippine Star
notes: On 28 July 2020, a police officer was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Manuyo Uno, Las Pinas. The police officer was driving on his way home and is assumed off-duty.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; ABS CBN; Mindanao Goldstar Daily; Philippine News Agency
notes: On 29 July 2020, two government soldiers and 10 BIFF militants were killed, while 13 government soldiers and at least 10 BIFF militants were wounded, during clashes between the BIFF and the military in Barangay Penditen, Datu Salibo, Maguindanao, according to a military report. The BIFF disputed the details of the military report, however, and said that no BIFF militants died and only four were wounded on their side. BIFF fatalities coded at 0. The BIFF reportedly set off a roadside bomb in the morning before firing at the soldiers, who were on patrol in the area in search of a prominent Dawlah Islamiyah bombmaker. Clashes continued until nighttime.

On 29 July 2020, a Dawlah Islamiyah militant who was also a drug suspect was killed during a shootout with the police in Barangay Klinan 6, Polomolok, South Cotabato. No police officers were wounded during the shootout. Police said they retrieved shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Philippine News Agency
notes: On 29 July 2020, the NPA and the military engaged in a four-hour firefight in Barangay San Nicolas, San Jose de Buan, Samar. There were no reported casualties on both sides, though the military believed many NPA militants were wounded. The military said it seized the NPA camp in the area and retrieved several weapons and other items from the rebels.

On 30 July 2020, the son of a retired police general and former mayoral candidate was wounded alongside his companion in an attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Pantar Sur, Balaoan, La Union. Police said the motive for the attack was likely political.

On 30 July 2020, two government soldiers and an NPA militant were killed during a 45-minute firefight between the NPA and the military in Barangay Daganas, Bulan, Sorsogon. The military also reported retrieving weapons from the rebels.

Around 30 July 2020 (as reported), 1,588 families evacuated from five barangays in the neighboring towns of Datu Salibo and Shariff Saydona Mustapha in Maguindanao amid fighting between the BIFF and the military in the vicinity.

source: Philippine News Agency; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: On 30 July 2020, a police officer was shot dead by unidentified motorcycle-riding assailants in Marantao, Lanao del Sur (in Barangay Ragayan according to reports). The police officer was only just about to report for work and was on the way to the station when attacked. Police officer assumed still off-duty.

On 30 July 2020, a drug suspect who was serving as the board secretary of the Philippine Charity Sweepstakes Office (PCSO) was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants at the corner of Calbayog and Malinaw Streets in Mandaluyong. His driver was also wounded. The motive for the attack was unclear, though police said it was possibly work-related. Later reports said that the PCSO official was on Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte's 'narco list' of prominent personalities allegedly connected to the drug trade, which has been publicly released on multiple occasions since 2016.

assoc_actor_2: Drug Suspects (Philippines); Former Government of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: On 30 July 2020, a drug suspect (also a former barangay councilor) was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Pinyahan, Quezon City (Metro Manila, National Capital Region).

On 31 July 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Bulua, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental. Police said the slain suspect was a member of the Karanain Drug Group and was high on both the Zamboanga City drug watchlist and the Zamboanga Peninsula regional drug watchlist.

source: GMA News; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Philippine Star; Manila Bulletin
notes: On 31 July 2020, six Abu Sayyaf militants and three government soldiers were killed, while three more government soldiers were wounded, during an hour-long firefight between the Abu Sayyaf and the military in Barangay Taung, Patikul, Sulu.
